Schedule

You can find the class schedule below. The dates and plans are subject to change. I'll notify you of any modifications during class or via email.

Part 1: Principles of RWD (HTML)

Sept
01

Class 1: RWD Principles

We'll cover a brief history of web design, web standards and why responsive design is important.

Read For Class
There's nothing to read for today.
Due Today
There's nothing due today.
Assigned Today
RWD Case Study
Sept
08

Class 2: HTML Basics

We'll discuss the basics of HTML and code some live HTML in class. We'll also set up GitHub accounts and version control for future assignments.

Read For Class
  • HTML&CSS - Introduction, Ch. 1 Structure, Ch.2 Text, Ch. 18 Process & Design (out of order)
  • Responsive Web Design - Ch. 1 Our Responsive Web
  • GitHub for Beginners
  • The Mobile Content Mandate (Video) by Karen McGrane)
Due Today
RWD Case Study
Assigned Today
HTML Basics 1
Sept
15

Class 3: Research and HTML Part 2

I'll introduce the semester project and we'll talk about developing research and goals for website projects. We'll also continue our HTML discussion with a hands-on lesson in class.

Read For Class
  • HTML&CSS - Ch. 3 Lists, Ch.4 Links
  • Focusing On Top Tasks
  • Interviewing Humans by Erika Hall
  • Bringing Design and Research Closer Together by Emma Boulton
Due Today
HTML Basics 1
Assigned Today
Semester Project (Introduced) and Research/Competitive Analysis

Part 2: Content Strategy and Mobile-First

Sept
22

Class 4: Content-First Design and HTML Part 3

We'll talk about how to prioritize content through content outlines and sketching. We'll practice with a hands-on content prioritization exercise. Finally, we'll finish our HTML lesson.

Read For Class
  • HTML&CSS - Ch. 5 Images, Ch.6 Tables, Ch.7 Forms, Ch.8 Extra Markup
  • Sketching - the Visual Thinking Power Tool by Mike Rohde
  • Structure First. Content Always. by Mark Boulton
  • Sketching a New Mobile Web
Due Today
Research/Competitive Analysis
Assigned Today
HTML Basics 2 and Project Sketches
Sept
29

Class 5: Information Architecture, HTML Wireframing and Mobile-First Design

We'll discuss information architecture and begin wireframing using HTML. We'll discuss why designing mobile-first is important. We'll also have a special guest speaker in class!

Read For Class
  • Mobile First - Ch. 1 Growth, Ch. 2 Constraints, Ch. 3 Capabilities
  • Content-First Design by Steph Hay
  • Content and Style Prototyping by Jeremy Lloyd
Due Today
HTML Basics 2 and Project Sketches
Assigned Today
Content & Architecture

Part 3: Visual Design and Development (CSS)

Oct
06

Class 6: Design Patterns, Style Tiles and CSS

In class we'll discuss how to develop a website's personality through design patterns and style tiles. In class, we'll use TypeCast, a tool to help choose typographic styles for the web. We'll also learn to use Sketch, a vector-based design tool. Finally, we'll begin discussing CSS.

Read For Class
  • HTML&CSS - Ch. 10 Introducing CSS
  • Mobile First - Ch.4 Organization, Ch. 5 Actions, Ch. 6 Inputs
  • Style Tiles and How They Work by Samantha Warren
  • Responsive Comping - Obtaining Client Feedback Without Mockups by Matt Griffin
  • Using Sketch for Responsive Web Design
Due Today
Content & Architecture
Assigned Today
CSS Basics
Oct
13

Class 7: Web Typography, Colors and CSS Part 2

We'll continue our discussion on web typography, colors and styles. We'll also do a hands-on CSS exercise in class using CodePen.

Read For Class
  • HTML&CSS - Ch. 11 Color, Ch. 12 Text, Ch. 14 Lists Tables & Forms
  • Our New Responsive Design Deliverable - The Style Prototype
  • How We Read by Jason Santa Maria
  • Understanding the CSS Box Model on Lynda.com
  • Size Matters - Balancing Line Length and Font Size in Responsive Web Design
  • Prototyping Responsive Typography
Due Today
Nothing due today
Assigned Today
Style Tiles
Oct
20

Class 8: Designing In The Browser, Atomic Design and CSS Part 3

We'll talk about designing in the browser and developing style prototypes. We'll also learn about the Atomic Design methodology, and continue our CSS lesson. Finally, we'll have an in-class critique/discussion about your style tiles.

Read For Class
  • Look at Reading Is Fundamental Example
  • HTML&CSS Ch. 13 Boxes, Ch. 15 Layout, Ch. 16 Images
  • Mobile First Ch. 7 Layout
  • Atomic Web Design by Brad Frost
  • Responsive Deliverables by Dave Rupert
Due Today
Style Tiles
Assigned Today
CSS Basics 2
Oct
27

Class 9: HTML/CSS Layout

We'll put it all together and talk about developing layout systems in HTML/CSS. We'll talk about recent advancements in CSS relating to layout. We'll practice with a hands-on assignment using media queries.

Read For Class
  • HTML&CSS - Ch. 17 HTML5 Layout
  • Responsive Web Design Ch. 2 The Flexible Grid, Ch. 3 Flexible Images, Ch. 4 Media Queries
  • Responsive Design Patterns
Due Today
CSS Basics 2
Assigned Today
Layout/Media Queries

Part 4: Prototyping, Testing and Style Guides

Nov
03

Class 10: Responsive Images, SVG and Templates

We talk about the advanced use of images in HTML, including responsive images and SVG. We'll also talk about pattern libraries and templating using GitHub Pages and Jekyll. We'll set up Jekyll in class.

Read For Class
  • Using SVG by Chris Coyier
  • Getting Started with Pattern Libraries by Anna Debenham
  • Responsive Images Done Right by Eric Portis
  • Getting Started With GitHub Pages
  • Mo' Pixels Mo' Problems
Due Today
Layout/Media Queries
Assigned Today
HTML Content Wireframes
Nov
10

Class 11: JavaScript, Performance Testing and Preprocessors

We'll talk about adding interaction to your website using Jquery and JavaScript. We'll also learn how to ensure websites perform well through progressive enhancement and performance testing. Finally, we'll touch on how CSS preprocessors can speed up your development time.

Read For Class
  • Fast Enough by Tim Kadlec
  • Responsive Web Design - Ch. 5 Becoming Responsive
  • How we make RWD Sites load fast as heck by Scott Jehl
  • Understanding Progressive Enhancement by Aaron Gustafson
Due Today
HTML Content Wireframes
Assigned Today
Performance & Usability Testing
Nov
17

Class 12: Device Testing, Usability Testing and Iteration

We'll discuss how to ensure your website works well on multiple devices and browsers using the IdeaBase testing lab in class. We'll also talk about accessibility and why it's important. Finally, we'll also discuss how to develop usability and accessibility testing tasks and how to iterate on your design.

Read For Class
  • Usability testing - how do we design effective tasks by Tingting Zhao
  • Reframing Accessibility for the Web by Anne Gibson
  • Web Accessibility Checklist
  • Test on Real Mobile Devices Without Breaking the Bank by Brad Frost
Due Today
Nothing due today
Assigned Today
HTML/CSS Templates
Nov
24

Class 13: Usability Testing In Class + Pattern Library

We conduct our usability tests in class and discuss how we can document our designs using style guides. We'll also discuss how your designs and content might be integrated into an enterprise-level content management system.

Read For Class
  • Style Guide Best Practices by Brad Frost
  • How To Make a Performance Budget by Dan Mall
  • Help Your Content Go Anywhere With A Mobile Content Strategy by Kerry Crawford
Due Today
Performance & Usability Testing Plan
Assigned Today
Style Guide & Pattern Library
Dec
01

Class 14: Finalizing Prototypes and Style Guides

We'll conduct a second round of usability testing, and we'll finalize our content templates and pattern libraries based on testing feedback. We'll have a special guest speaker during class!

Read For Class
The Post-PSD Era by Dan Mall and How Much Does a Responsive Web Design Cost? by Brad Frost
Due Today
Nothing assigned today
Assigned Today
Project Timeline and Prototype Demos
Dec
08

Class 15: Mock Client Presentations

Groups will complete mock client feedback sessions with the class, and the class will evaluate the sessions based on the project goals and usability testing results. We'll also complete self assessments and the course evaluation.

Read For Class
Client Relationships and the Multi-Device Web
Due Today
HTML/CSS Templates and Style Guide & Pattern Library
Assigned Today
Self & Group Assessment

Final Exam: Tuesday, Dec 15 - 5:45 - 8:00 p.m.

You will not have a formal final exam. Your final prototype and pattern library will act as your final. We'll continue presentations and critiques during the final exam period, if needed.

Due Today
Project Timeline and Self & Group Assessment
